page.title: 13CUSTOMS_ THE COURT LEET
page.content: Northleach is the only town in England to have a Court Leet. It was the only system of government in the Middle Ages. Today, it meets every Autumn. The people elected at the Court are a high bailiff who is like a mayor, two constables who were originally police officers, a tythingman who used to check the produce sold at the market and a hayward who collected all the cows from the town and took them to the Downs. Now the young people carry on the tradition by tin_banging when the high bailiff is elected. The election takes place in the Wheatsheaf Hotel and in the evening there is a big dinner in the Cotswold Hall for the men.
